abstracts.cdata!:
The objective of the Education for
            All-Fast Track Initiative Project for Guyana is to support
            the Ministry of Education in attaining the goal of universal
            primary school completion for boys and girls by 2015 with an
            emphasis on improving the quality of education and an
            increase in literacy and numeracy. The reallocation is
            necessary to reallocate the remaining funds in category ten
            (works, goods, consultants' services, Remote Area (RA)
            incentives, training and operational costs) to category six
            (SFP). Given the upcoming closing of this project (October
            1, 2012), this reallocation seeks to make use of unspent
            balances to further the success of the School Feeding
            Program (SFP).
